body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, w0), wex(s0, w0))
-| wex(s0, wi(w0, w0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, w0), wex(s0, w0))
-| wex(s0, wi(w0, w0))

|- wi(wal(s0, w0), wex(s0, w0))
-| wi(w0, w0)

comment: Theorem 19.2 of [Margaris] p. 89. This corresponds to the axiom (D) of modal logic (the other standard formulation being ~ extru ). Note: This proof is very different from Margaris' because we only have Tarski's FOL axiom schemes available at this point. See the later ~ 19.2g for a more conventional proof of a more general result, which uses additional axioms. The reverse implication is the defining property of effective nonfreeness (see ~ df-nf ). (Contributed by NM, 2-Aug-2017.) Remove dependency on ~ ax-7 . (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 4-Dec-2017.)
